content.description: This is currently the furthest right bolted line at the Waffle House. Start up a runnel which turns in to face climbing on chickenheads to the tippy-top.

This is the furthest left bolted line at the Waffle House which begins with a mantel. What appears to be slab above the mantel actually has thought-provoking face features. When the climbing features thin, complete a slabby mantel which guides you to easier climbing to the anchors. The crux is between bolts 3-5.

Begin just left of a small pine tree at eye level. A mantel leads to the first bolt followed by thought provoking slab/face climbing. Â At the roof crux, decode the sequence for your ergonomics, and pull the two move wonder to easier terrain. Finish on the last two bolts of

No Shirt, No Service

, and use its anchors.

Begin by climbing up some blocks to the first bolt. Continue up a few short tiers to a short section of slab. A steep dihedral followed by a mantel leads to the anchor which is shared with

Just a Pancake With Syrup

.
content.location:
This route is just a few feet right of

Just a Pancake With Syrup

.

content.description:
Start up a slab following a small crack which leads to a small roof. Escape right, and climb run-out slab or sneak further right and use the last 3 bolts of

Bacon is a Food Group

. The slab at the top can protect and was originally led before

Bacon is a Food Group

was equipped. Use the

Bacon is a Food Group's

anchor to descend.
content.protection: A single rack of BD C4 #0.3-#2, nuts, and optional RPs.
content.location:
Begin up the crack left of the arete that

Bacon is a Food Group

is located.

content.description: Start just below an angled, granite stalactite. Climb up, bear hug, and climb past the stalactite. Easy climbing leads to a juggy roof (super fun) that leads to the anchor.
Start with a tricky move that leads to easy terrain. A long section of fun chickenheads followed by small roof leads to the anchor.
Engaging climbing leads to a short section of slab. Conquer the roof, and motor on easy terrain to the anchor.
content.location:
This line starts just right of

Coffee With Cream

.

content.description: Power your way up a steep face. An interesting mantel mid-route keeps things exciting.
content.location:
This starts up the semi-overhung, short wall left of

Coffee, Black

and right of

Bacon is a Food Group

.

content.description: Begin up the bolted line just right of the very large dead tree. Easy slab leads to a thought provoking roof (crux). Rewarding chickenheads then lead to the anchor.
content.location:
This is the bolted line left of

Just a Pancake With Syrup

.

content.description:
Climb up the black rock to a thought provoking stem box. After the fourth bolt, traverse right and join

Coffee With Cream

for the last 3 bolts. Too bad it isn't longer.
content.location: Start just right of a large mossy/dirty dihedral (don't worry, the climb has been cleaned/brushed).

content.description:
Climb the left-facing dihedral just right of

Coffee, Black

. The climbing reminds me of something you might find in Eldo. Think your way past the third bolt (crux), and continue with enjoyable climbing to the anchor.

This route makes for a quality beginner trad lead. From the first bolt at

Manager's Special

, cut right, and follow a series of vertical cracks to the anchor of

The Belgian

.

This is the House Favorite and might qualify for one of the best single pitch 5.7 bolted routes at Devil's Head.

Begin up some large boulders to reach the first bolt. The crux is at the second bolt. Pull on chickenheads to get past the crux, and continue with fun climbing to the anchor.
Fun buckets and rails lead to a crux at the third bolt. After the fourth bolt, motor on easy slab to the anchor.

Begin in a right facing dihedral, and stem your way up the crack. Bust an awkward mantel (the left handholds are a bit crunchy), clip a bolt, and continue on slab to

No Shirt, No Service's

anchors.
content.protection: A select single rack of BD C4 #0.4-3 and nuts.
